channel.title: E2e Testing on kodebot
channel.description: Recent content in E2e Testing on kodebot

item.title: Selenium and Page Objects
item.description: I use Selenium or Protractor for E2E tests that require browser automation. I prefer to use Selenium when I want to write my tests in C# and Protractor for AngularJS applications. It doesn't matter what tool/framework you use, if you want to bring in structure and make your test code reusable when dealing with any UI automation then Page Object is your friend. I have been creating my Page Objects incorrectly with two major flaws until I read this great article from Martin Fowler.
